posts.content:
Hello all,

I wonder if anyone out there can help? I'm after a picture of the bulkhead version of the Devon Spaceway conversion? I can only seem to find pictures of walkthrough Spaceways.

I'm aiming to see how the seat works against the bulkhead. Did these come with the swing out cooker or was it door mounted? how big was the seat that went up against the bulkhead?

Many thanks
Lee.

spaceway was the term used to describe walkthrough versions of devons

so all space ways are walkthrough, if it has a bulkhead, its just a caravette..or devonetteâ€¦or torvette, they then did space way versions on the later models (except the devonette, which was essentially renamed as the torvette)

As above.

So your layout for a bulkhead version has a wardrobe and a 3/4 seat with a slider unit above it.

And your cooker is in the unit next to the rear seat. (Unless it's <63 in which case it's in a door cupboard)

Google e.g. '1965 Devon Caravette' and look at images.

If you want the swing out cooker then you will have to fit a Spaceway ie walk through interior against the bulkhead. Or a pre 63 door cooker.

Brochures here on this forum in my sticky or here
http://www.devonmoonraker.pwp.blueyonde ... hures.html
The 65 and 66 brochures are the first to mention the Spaceway and to differentiate the standard...

Wow thank you folks, there it is... I actually have a 67 'Torvette Standard'. I've had this van since 1994 and I never knew that! It certainly never clicked that a spaceway was a walkthrough. I guess the name makes sense now.

In all honesty my van is presently a Canterbury Pitt as that is the interior I fitted in 1999 - after I threw the old Torvette interior into a skip! It was terribly badly painted and butchered, but if I knew then what I knew now I would have kept it.

Anywho, I soon regretted throwing away the old interior and converting my van to the wrong breed. Soooo over the intervening years I have collected the correct interior back together again. I actually have two almost complete Torvette interiors waiting in the wings (including a mint easicool and full width slider cabinet). I still can't quite see how the front bulkhead seat works as I think the seats I have, with both of my interiors, are Torvette Spaceway seats.

Is there anyone else out there with a Torvette Standard? If so could I perv a pic of the bulkhead seat?

The cool brochures link has also shown me that the old fold up cooker, I once had, would have fitted above the easicool. I've never seen another again, but I do have the older cooker for the door mounted box. Not perfect but probably more practical. Just need to source a cooker box!

Thanks to everyone who has helped above, I'm genuinly enlightened!

There is a thread on this forum if you scroll down a bit which has photos of a Torvette bulkhead seat. From memory it seems a bit like a Spaceway in that it has two separate seats, except in this case they can slide together to make a bench.

....and my friend Mark Buckingham has Torvette Spaceway kombi...
I posted his pictures for the Devon Spaceway bed making tutorial. ..
